Package ohos.event.intentagent

Provides a mechanism for pending execution.

IntentAgent provides a pending intent mechanism to perform an action only when certain conditions are met or certain events are triggered. For example, after you receive a notification, a new ability will be triggered only if you click this notification. The actions to be performed include abilities and common events.

When you send an IntentAgent to another application, the application is granted all the permissions you have.

You can obtain a different IntentAgent only if a different request code is carried in the IntentAgentInfo object or the intents in the previous and new IntentAgentInfo objects are found different by using Intent.equals(Object).

Since:
3
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IntentAgent.OnCompleted
    A callback for the IntentAgentHelper#triggerIntentAgent(Context, IntentAgent, IntentAgent.OnCompleted, EventHandler, TriggerInfo) method.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    IntentAgent
    Provides a pending intent mechanism to perform an action only when certain conditions are met or certain events are triggered.
    IntentAgentConstant
    Provides enumerated constants that are used for setting object attributes in the methods provided by IntentAgentInfo.
    IntentAgentHelper
    A helper class used to obtain, trigger, cancel, and compare IntentAgent objects and to obtain the bundle name, UID, and hash code value of an IntentAgent object.
    IntentAgentInfo
    A parametric class that contains the parameters required by IntentAgentHelper#getIntentAgent.
    TriggerInfo
    A parametric class that contains the parameters required by IntentAgentHelper#triggerIntentAgent.
    TriggerInfo.Builder
    A builder class for TriggerInfo objects.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    IntentAgentConstant.Flags
    Enumerates flags for using an IntentAgent.
    IntentAgentConstant.OperationType
    Identifies the operation for using an IntentAgent, such as starting an ability or sending a common event.
